[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/network_config.rs] [Identity Integration] Can mismatched identity configurations between network_config and consensus_config allow Byzantine validators to impersonate others? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/network_config.rs] [Config Validation Order] Are all validation functions (verify_seeds, prepare_identity) called in correct order, or can initialization race conditions skip validations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/network_config.rs] [Key Rotation] Does the configuration support safe key rotation, or can changing identity keys mid-operation cause validators to lose their stake? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/network_config.rs] [Network Partitioning] Can attackers exploit different discovery_methods across validators to create network partitions where subsets use incompatible peer sets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/network_config.rs] [Consensus Timing] Can manipulating ping_interval_ms, ping_timeout_ms, and connectivity_check_interval_ms cause consensus timing violations? (High)
